data.title: Hashemi : Saudi Arabia (SAU)

data.text:
Hášimí, Abdalláh ibn Husajn al-

Abdalláh ibn Hussein al-Hashemi

عبد الله الأول بن الحسين

- král Zajordánské hášimovské království (1946-1949)

- král Jordánské hášimovské království (1949-1951) - emir Emirate of Transjordan (1921-1946)

- king Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan (1949-1951)Jiné významné skutečnosti:

Other Notable Facts:

(up to three) - byl na něj v roce 1951 proveden atentát, kterému na místě podlehl - he was assassinated in 1951, to which he succumbed on the spotSouvisející články:

URL : https://www.valka.cz/Hasimi-Abdallah-ibn-Husajn-al-t129415#436208 Version : 0

Abdullah ibn Hussein al-Hášimí was born in 1882 in Mecca, the emir and šarifovi Hussein ibn Ali al-Hášimía his first wife, which was Abdliya bin Abdullah. Abdullah ibn Hussein was the second son at the time of birth have already had about 3 years older brother Ali. As the son of Hussein ibn Ali al-Hášimího was in the 40. generation direct descendant of the prophet Muhammad.

During the first world war was Abdullah the mediator between his father and the British, who have become allies Hášimovců. When in June 1916 proclaimed emir in Mecca, sheriff Hussein the father of Abdullah, the uprising of the bedouin against the ottoman empire, became Abdullah the commander of the troops, in which he was "Lawrence of Arabia" liaison officer, so I personally met. During the war he led the Abdullah successfully the troops of his father, who was king of Hidžázu. With the army came up to Jordan and Damascus, syria.

In 1904 he was married to Musbah bint Nasser (1884-1961) (jordan queen), with her he had 3 children: princess Haya (1907-1990)

Talal - (1909 -1972), the future king

princess Munira - (1915-1987)

In 1913 married his second wife Suzdil Khanum (died 1968), with her he had 2 children: prince Naif ibn Abdullah - (1914 -1983), regent for half brother Talal in 1951, a colonel in the jordanian army

princess Maqbula (1921-2001)

In 1949 he married his third wife Nahda bint Uman, a few unfortunately didn't have children..
